ygData.subject: Re: PoA bard quests plus a rant
ygData.msgSnippet: Nah E ci is what I like ot call the power gaming server. We have so many 46+ people it s not even funny hell we have people working on their 4 char trying to
ygData.messageBody:
Nah E'ci is what I like ot call the power gaming server. We have so many 46+
people it's not even funny hell we have people working on their 4 char
trying to get it to 50.

Naeeldar

-----Original Message-----
From: jhenders@... <jhenders@...>
To: eqbards@onelist.com <eqbards@onelist.com>
Date: Monday, January 24, 2000 2:38 PM
Subject: Re: [eqbards] PoA bard quests plus a rant


>From: jhenders@...
>
>On Mon, Jan 24/00, "Kimes, Dean W." <Dean_Kimes@...> wrote:
>> From: "Kimes, Dean W." <Dean_Kimes@...>
>>
>> Ok, that's not a problem. First, they haven't successfully implemented
any
>> new quests a 21st level bard can do in a very long time. I've tried a
>> couple they did add to see if they might be viable, but both were broken
so
>> I couldn't even find out if they were of an appropriate level for me.
I've
>> done every other quest, or gotten as far as I could in them, that I might
be
>> able to do.
>> On the area of zones. Yes, I can hunt on reaver hill. Mistmoore is too
>> deadly for me as higher levels train things out of the castle too
frequently
>> to make the entry area safe. Unrest is packed, last three times I was
there
>> there were 50+ people in them. Sol A and Sol B are obviously beyond my
>> groups ability at 21-24. Haven't tried Paw since they lowered the
>> difficulty but there was no way before. Befallen is also fairly crowded
and
>> most everything there is too low to give me much xp anyhow. Tried
hunting
>> skeletons in rathe but there were too many groups there as well. Went to
S
>> Karana but there were 75+ people there mostly hunting aviaks.
>
>This sounds like you're on a 1800+ server, and thus a complaint about
>that, rather than not enough places to go. If Verant had stuck to their
>original 1500 max per server (and dispite their denials I remember them
>stating this in beta. They shut down all the servers but one one day and
>asked us all to log in specifically to test if the server could take
>that many) then you wouldn't have these problems. They now seem to be
>relying on people sticking it out until the expansion when they can hope
>that the current server populations will be more comfortable with the
>addition of the extra zones but personally I think their reluctance to
>put new servers online in a timely manner will hurt them in the long
>run.
>
>
